oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soil sustainability in organic agricultural production
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: May-Roberts, S
Robertson, J
Killham, K
Paton, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Traditionally, the assessment of soil sustainability and the potential impact of cultivation are based upon the application of chemical procedures. In the absence of a biological context, these measurements offer little in understanding longterm changes in soil husbandry. Detailed microcosm investigations were applied as a predictive tool for management change. The microcosms were designed with homogenised soils treated with organic amendments. Key soil functional relationships were quantified using stable isotope techniques, biochemical measurements and traditional approaches.
